prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, tilted slightly to the right. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: 1. Set the Euler angles to -90.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees. The rotation order is around the X-axis, then the Y-axis, and finally the Z-axis. 2. Set the translation vector to 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. This means the origin of the part's local coordinate system aligns with the global coordinate system's origin. Next, create the 2D sketch: 1. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw 8 connected line segments to form a closed loop (faces are always closed). For more detail on each line segment, see their respective start and end points. Remember, each line is straight and connects the start point to the end point: a. Line 1: (0.0, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.0) b. Line 2: (0.5, 0.0) to (0.5, 0.625) c. Line 3: (0.5, 0.625) to (0.375, 0.625) d. Line 4: (0.375, 0.625) to (0.375, 0.5) e. Line 5: (0.375, 0.5) to (0.125, 0.5) f. Line 6: (0.125, 0.5) to (0.125, 0.625) g. Line 7: (0.125, 0.625) to (0.0, 0.625) h. Line 8: (0.0, 0.625) to (0.0, 0.0) After creating the 2D sketch, extrude the sketch into a 3D model: 1. Apply a scaling factor of 0.625 to the 2D sketch. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch towards the positive Z-axis to a depth of 0.75 (the prism height). 3. Create a new solid body, as the result of this extrusion. This part's dimensions, as described in the JSON, are as follows: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.625 - Height: 0.625</description>
